name: Hardwood Decking on Quickbuild checklist
Template Name: SYS - Hardwood Decking on Quickbuild checklist (old version)

name: Pre-install checks
Establish FDL (finished deck level) as per the Outdure plan.
Please confirm onsite with the customer/main contractor.
The substrate is clear & free of debris, no visible defects (take photos)
Identify & open the Outdure box with the Pink sticker.
This box contains all the necessary documentation including layout plan etc.
Check that all Outdure materials are correct,Quickbuild subframe componentry, surface fixings are delivered as per the packing slip. (Upload photo of docket)
If unavailable please contact Outdure - 080077 88 77 and request
Quickbuild Aluminum Subframe Category
Place bearers directly on to substrate in approx correct positions.(please refer to Outdure joist & bearer plan.)
Measure & Cut to length all boundary/perimeter joists, to form up a basic outline of external sub-frame with adequate clearances to cladding/joinery (15mm optimal).
Measure & cut to length all joists, fix off against boundary perimeter joists with necessary Outdure components as per production drawing supplied or Outdure Design guide specifications.
Move the entire subframe to the correct position with relevant clearances confirmed from cladding/joinery.(take photos).
Move bearers to correct positions, ensuring spans/spacings are as per the Outdure production plan or design guide. (take photos)
Identify jacks by size and place in approximate locations adjacent to each bearer or joist.
Calculate Top of frame based on FDL, Place jacks under bearers/joists to outside corners of the frame and mid-span under bearers/joists, adjust jack heights to obtain correct frame height.
Place remaining jacks and adjust frame height using Laser Level or similar
Obtain FDL of subframe using a dumpy laser level, adjusting jacks to the exact height, maintaining a flat level surface (take photos).
Once the installer is satisfied with the entire subframe being level, the jacks must all be fixed off to bearer, to lock them into position. (Please upload photos)
Surface Installation
Prequalify & Identify any site specific requirements & recommend the most suitable screw fastener grade screws.
Identify the correct hardwood screw fasteners & check to ensure the selected hardwood deck gauging (width & thickness) is compatible with the proposed screw fastener (Take a photo).
Please note: It is compulsory to use a self drilling screw to achieve adequate hold down capacity through the (2mm) first wall of QB aluminum joist profile.

Correct size countersink drill bit must be used to achieve a seamless acceptable result, the face fixed screws must finish consistently at the same depth (approx 1.5mm beneath the surface of the deck board) the pilot hole drill bit should ideally go through the thickness of the deck board & into the aluminum joist leaving an even diameter opening the same measurement as the screw head.

Identify the length spec of selected Hardwood decking ,Grade timber lengths accordingly & try & economize to achieve minimum wastage - resulting in a random stagger arrangement on the butt joins,check the gauging (width) on each deck board to ensure the butt join is an acceptable match. Both ends are accurately square cut & arised to remove any textured dags of hardwood fibres. (Take Photo)

If random stagger layout method is applicable (Consult for client confirmation) please locate the Outdure DJB - (Double Joist Bracket) displayed Flat side up which is clipped & screwed from the underside (H16mm tech screws) creating a platform where a butt joint has occurred - (Take Photo)
Please note: Do not attempt to join the hardwood deck board halfway on the Outdure joist profile without the use of the DJB Flat.

Once starting point has been established (typically working from Balustrade to Building line) position the first deck board level flush with the outer boundary joist & fix off into the joist framing members(take a photo).
Gaps in between Hardwood deck boards must be a consistent 4mm (Take photo)
When screwing off the hardwood decking boards please ensure that all screw lines are dead straight, square & uniform (Take photo)

Every 4 - 5 rows of boards installed, check the parallel measurements back to the structure to ensure the boards are running straight & parallel & that all visible lines are true & uniform (take a photo)

Once the installer has reached the end of where the decking is terminated against the building line, the last decking board needs to be cut to length, ripped down to required width, whilst still maintaining the 12mm standoff from the cladding/joinery - NZBC mandatory standard (Take Photo)

The last decking board or ripped board must also be screwed off (face fixed) to match in with the existing screw lines using the selected screw. This decking board must be screwed off @ approx 400mm centers to frame installation. (Take photo)
A Hardwood fascia trim board may be necessary to conceal the QB subframe (please check design requirements & consult with client)

The trim boards or fascia piece must be screwed off @ 400mm centers, into the subframe boundary joist with the correct selected screw fastener (The Outdure trim bracket may be necessary to gain additional fixing points dependant on the QB boundary joist profile size)
Handover
Area left clean and tidy, (may be necessary to use cordless blower or vacuum off finished surface area,take photos)
Please note: It may be necessary to use a fine sandpaper to remove any cosmetic scratches/visible defects
Send report of the deck to the Main Contractor
Composite Decking on Quickbuild checklist V2
Template Name: SYS - Composite Decking on Quickbuild checklist (old version)

name: Pre-install checks
Establish FDL (finished deck level) as per the Outdure plan.
Please confirm onsite with the customer/main contractor.
The substrate is clear & free of debris, no visible defects.(take photos).
Identify & open the Outdure box with the orange sticker.
This box contains all the necessary documentation including layout plan etc.
Check that all Outdure materials are correct, composite decking board specified/color, fixings, components, are delivered as per the packing slip. (Upload photo of docket)
Please read frame design documents supplied (Outdure design & installation guide, or site specific production plan)
If unavailable please contact Outdure - 080077 88 77 and request
Quickbuild Aluminum Subframe Category
Place bearers directly on to substrate in approx correct positions.(please refer to Outdure joist & bearer plan.)
Measure & Cut to length all boundary/perimeter joists, to form up a basic outline of external sub-frame with adequate clearances to cladding/joinery (15mm optimal).
Measure & cut to length all joists, fix off against boundary perimeter joists with necessary Outdure components as per production drawing supplied or Outdure Design guide specifications.
Move the entire subframe to the correct position with relevant clearances confirmed from cladding/joinery.(take photos).
Move bearers to correct positions, ensuring spans/spacings are as per the Outdure production plan or design guide. (take photos)
Identify jacks by size and place in approximate locations adjacent to each bearer or joist.
Calculate Top of frame based on FDL, Place jacks under bearers/joists to outside corners of the frame and mid-span under bearers/joists, adjust jack heights to obtain correct frame height.
Place remaining jacks and adjust frame height using Laser Level or similar
Obtain FDL of subframe using a dumpy laser level, adjusting jacks to the exact height, maintaining a flat level surface (take photos).
Once the installer is satisfied with the entire subframe being level, the jacks must all be fixed off to bearer, to lock them into position. (Please upload photos)
Surface Installation
Please identify the specified Outdure composite deck board - Casa Endura or Resort Deck along with the correct selected color (please confirm with the packing slip or SON)

Follow the Outdure surface layout plan as a general guide, board layout, start point, etc., typically working in a sequence from the front of the deck to the building line. Once starting point has been established install starter snap clips that retain the first decking board.(take a photo).
Identify the correct composite screw fasteners & check to ensure the selected composite deck gauging (width & thickness) is compatible with the proposed screw fastener (Take a photo).

While installing decking boards ensure correct Outdure fixings & components are being used; Twist clips, fitted into the groove of each decking board on every joist which regulates the 6mm gap between boards.(take a photo).
Ensure the correct standoff from the cladding is applied (12mm) this is mandatory for NZ building code. (Take photo).

15mm Pinning screw, fixed sideways into the decking board through the twist clip, either at mid-span of decking board or at one end only to control the expansion & contraction of the board.(take a photo).

If random stagger layout method is applicable (Consult for client confirmation) please locate the Outdure DJB - (Double Joist Bracket) displayed Flat side up which is clipped & screwed from the underside (H16mm tech screws) creating a platform where a butt joint has occurred - (Take Photo)
Vertical pinning screw through the twist clip into the joist to control & lock the board into position, these screws should be installed on every third row of decking boards.(take a photo).

Every 8-10th row of boards installed, check the parallel measurements back to the structure to ensure the boards are running straight & parallel & that all visible lines are true & uniform.(take a photo).Other methods to achieve this can be a simple cross-check with a PLS laser or a string line.

Any butt joins on the surface of the decking area, must be arised ideally with a small butt plane to remove the sharp edge of the square-cut decking board.The gaps on each butt-join are determined by the temperature onsite on the day of installation eg; The boards are being laid in midday summer sun & are at the max capacity in terms of expansion/growth (0.5mm optimal gap), Or the boards are being unloaded off the pallet cold to the touch-first thing onsite in the early morning (3-4mm optimal gap.)

Once 1/4 of the deck install has been completed it is important to preserve the surface the use of (drop sheets, rubber matting, protective fabrics, etc) while the install is being undertaken & critical for a handover period to the customer/main contractor that the new deck is completely free of any type of damage, cosmetic scratches, etc. (take photo)

Once the installer has reached the end of where the decking is terminated against the building line, the last decking board needs to be cut to length, ripped down to required width, whilst still maintaining the 12mm standoff from the cladding/joinery.

This last decking board must also be screwed off (face fixed) using the correct color-matched screw eg; (Sea Salt decking board = grey tipped screw).This decking board must be screwed off @ approx 400mm centers, adjacent to each joist,the screw itself must not be countersunk enabling the decking board to expand & contract freely (please refer to Outdure Install & design guide for pre-drill size recommendations etc.) (take photo)

All 180mm Outdure trim boards must be installed correctly (as per the Outdure Installation Design guide). The trim boards must be screwed off @ 400mm centers, into the subframe boundary joist with the correct color-matched screw.
A composite fascia trim board may be necessary to conceal the QB subframe (please check design requirements & consult with client)

The same principles apply with the trim boards as is the composite decking board for installation purposes.ie;(butt-join gaps, pre arised square cuts, etc) Aside from any corner junctions, the trim board must have a 45deg miter cut hard together to form a seamless corner with screws evenly spaced. (take photo)
Handover
Area left clean and tidy, (may be necessary to use cordless blower or vacuum off finished surface area,take photos)
Please note: It may be necessary to use a fine sandpaper to remove any cosmetic scratches/visible defects
Send report of the deck to the Main Contractor
Ultralush Turf on Quickbuild checklist
Pre-install checks
The substrate is clear & free of debris, no visible defects.(take photos).
Identify & open the Outdure box with the Pink sticker.
This box contains all the necessary documentation including layout plan etc.
Check that all Outdure materials are have been delivered and are correct as per packing slip
Mineral or stone Tile, specified/color, fixings, components, and frames, are delivered as per the packing slip. (take photo of the docket)
Please read frame design documents supplied (Outdure design & installation guide, or site specific production plan)
If unavailable please contact Outdure. 0800005824
Establish FDL (finished deck level) as per the Outdure plan.
Please confirm onsite with the customer/main contractor.
Installer to sign the Outdure drawing & take a photo/video or confirmation of FDL via email.
Aluminum Subframe Category
Place bearers directly on to substrate in approx correct positions.
Please refer to Outdure joist & bearer plan to confirm maximum joist span(bearer spacing), avoid placing bearers over drains requiring maintenance
Measure & Cut to length all boundary/perimeter joists,to form up a basic external frame outline
Adequate clearances of external frame to cladding/joinery (15mm optimal)
Identify and confirm with main contractor locations for access hatches in deck frame.
Hatches allow for maintenance of substrate and unblocking of drains.
Markout joist locations on boundary joists.
Check joist spacing (max 400mm for turf board)
Fix off joists to boundary joists
Follow production drawing supplied or Outdure Design guide specifications for correct fixing number and placement
Move the entire subframe to the correct position with relevant clearances
Minimum 12mm from cladding and joinery see architect details or Section E2 NZBC for more detail.
Move bearers to correct positions, (take photos)
Ensure spans/spacings are as per the Outdure production plan or design guide.
Cut and trim out openings for hatches where required
Frame up and fit Hatch panels into openings.
Identify jacks by size and place in approximate locations adjacent to each bearer or joist.
All Outdure jacks are color coded on the plan to differentiate between sizes. Ensure spacer tabs are removed from the Tile Head(the white cap on the top of the jacks)
Calculate level for top of joists based on FDL-thickness of surface material.
Surface thickness for turf system =9mm turfboard + approx 14mm turf.
Place jacks under bearers/joists at outside corners of the frame and at approx 5m centers between.
Adjust jack heights to bring the top of the joists to the previously calculated level.
Use a dumpy or laser level.
Place remaining jacks in correct positions and adjust to correct height.
Check frame level using spirit level(take photo)
Adjust jacks to the exact height, ensuring that the entire sub frame is a flat & level surface,(take photos).
Fix off Jacks to bearers and bearers to joists.(take photos)
Bearer to jack fixing user either hex screw through bottom flange into top of jack or Ms sealant depending on clearance available to membrane.
Baseboard Installation

Identify the starting point for the Turf deck/podium install, place starter snap clips to edge of boundary joist and install first baseboard. Screw fix baseboard with 2 screws at 400mm ctrs with QB-F30mm flat head screw.
Ensure correct Outdure fixings & components are being used. Ensure at least one screw through turfboard into joist on each board to stop "board creep"
Boards may also be screwed periodically as required to stop movement during installation.
Ensure the minimum standoff from the cladding is present as per NZBC and or Architects details.
Turf Surface Installation
Before commencing Turf install,check to ensure to surface of the baseboard subframe is free of debris
Check to ensure all turf roll lines are straight,uniform & parallel during the install process.(Take Photo)

Turf may need to be rolled out and left flat to allow it to settle down and remove tension obtained in the roll. Do not bend roll the during transport or storage. Always store roll fully supported, do not store on dunnage.

Check the lay of the pile is the same either side of joins.For best results the synthetic turf fibres need to be brushed upright (vertically against the grain) in a uniform direction so visibly to the eye the fibres & color variation can be aesthetically pleasing from access point of direction (installer discretion advised)

Ensure turf is fixed with QB-F20 along all edges at max 150mm centers and 800mm centers within the main body of the turf. Turf joins should be all but invisible.Site specific locations may (elevation dependant) may require additional frequency of screw patterns to combat uplift please identify if necessary.
Helpful videos on cutting and joining can be found on sites such as https://www.artificialgrass.com/knowledge-hub/
Handover
Area left clean and tidy, (may be necessary to use cordless blower or vacuum off finished turf surface area, take photos)
Send report of the deck to the Main Contractor
Tiles on Quickbuild checklist
Template Name: SYS - Tiles on Quickbuild checklist (old version)

name: Pre-install checks
Establish FDL (finished deck level) as per the Outdure plan.
Please confirm onsite with the customer/main contractor.
Installer to sign the Outdure drawing & take a photo/video or confirmation of FDL via email.
The substrate is clear & free of debris, no visible defects.(take photos).
Identify & open the Outdure box with the Pink sticker.
This box contains all the necessary documentation including layout plan etc.
Check that all Outdure materials are correct and as per packing slip
Mineral or stone Tile, specified/color, fixings, components, are delivered as per the packing slip (take a photo of the docket).
Please read frame design documents supplied (Outdure design & installation guide, or site specific production plan)
If unavailable please contact Outdure.
Quickbuild Aluminum Subframe Category
Place bearers directly on to substrate in approx correct positions. Please refer to Outdure joist & bearer plan
Check correct joist span (bearer spacing)
Measure & Cut to length all boundary/perimeter joists,to form up a basic external frame outline
Adequate clearances of external frame to cladding/joinery (15mm optimal)
Measure & cut to length all joists,fix off against boundary perimeter joists with necessary Outdure components
Follow production drawing supplied or Outdure Design guide specifications.
Check joist spacing (typically 600mm centers)
Check brackets used.(alternating end to end either side of joist)
Move the entire subframe to the correct position with relevant clearances
Clearance confirmed from cladding/joinery, approx 15mm.(take photos).
Move bearers to correct positions (take photos)
Ensure spans/spacings are as per the Outdure production plan or design guide.
Identify jacks by size and place in approximate locations adjacent to each bearer or joist.
All Outdure jacks are color coded on the plan to differentiate between sizes.
Calculate Top of sub frame frame based on FDL, using a dumpy laser level or similar.
Adjust jack heights to obtain correct frame height.
Place jacks under bearers/joists to outside corners of the frame and mid-span under bearers/joists
Place remaining jacks in correct positions.
Check frame level using spirit level(take photo)
Adjust jacks to the exact height, ensuring that the entire sub frame is a flat & level surface,(take photos).
Jacks must all be fixed off to bearers, to lock them into position.
(usually using a 65mm tech screw, fixed through bearer,or a bead of sealant only @ low height applied to either side to position & locate it to bearer).Please provide photos.
Check to ensure every rubber strap is firmly inserted into the channel,atop every joist.(Take photo)
Surface Installation

Identify the starting point for the Tile deck install & follow the Outdure surface symmetry layout plan (please consult with client). Check for square & parallel against structure upon laying first grid line or row of tiles.
Install the retainer bracket clips that hold/locate the first line of tiles on perimeter boundary joist (Take Photo).
Ensure correct Outdure fixings & components are being used.
Install T-spacers & straights on all corner junctions which regulate the 5mm gap between tiles.(take photo).
Ensure the correct standoff from the cladding is applied, (12mm) This is mandatory for NZ building code. (take photo)
Check to ensure all tile gridlines are straight,uniform & parallel during the install process. (Take Photo)
Check to ensure cuts are of a clean straight & tidy standard, & visibly acceptable. (Take photo)
Identify termination point of decking surface against building line.
Please ensure all cut/ripped tiles are firmly locked into position pressing against each retainer bracket.(Take photo)

Identify if a tiled face edging is necessary (Design dependant) if so, the use of a tile edge trim bracket could be beneficial (depth dependant on specific aluminum profile).If bracket is redundant please direct fix tiled edge facing to boundary joist with Sika 11FC product.(take photo)
Handover
Area left clean and tidy, (maybe necessary to pressure wash or hose off surface area, take photos)
Send report of the deck to the Main Contractor
